hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1513 aen today's date is March
5th 2018 and the top of the episode is
as the economy collapses those in power
are taking sides let's get into the
economic collapse financial news now as
we can see we've been talking about a
transition and we've been talking about
cryptocurrency and we were talking about
the central banking system and we can
see at this point that we can go in
either direction depending on how
everything unfolds now what is happening
in the crypto market we're starting to
see companies like Amazon and many
others looking to accept some form of

going to be taxing those individuals
that are using crypto currency to
purchase goods we see right now that
PayPal well on March 1st they filed a
patent application for an expedited
virtual currency transaction system and
it looks like they're preparing to
accept crypto currencies and the last
time it was reported that PayPal filed a
patent application related to
cryptocurrencies was back in mid 2016
when it showed plans for a modular
payment module that accepted Bitcoin
litecoin and dodge coin now according to
Bitcoin comm the patent filing reveals
that PayPal might be considering
expanding its exposure to the
cryptocurrency ecosystem with a new
system for speedy transactions and when
I think is happening right now is
they're starting to realize that the
crypto market is going to play a very
very important role in the next economic
system and these corporations are
looking at this and they're they're
realizing they need to get on board now
if we stay with the Fayette system like
the central bankers want us to stay in
that direction they will probably
introduce some form of cryptocurrency
but it will be theirs now remember they
can have
government signed into law where they
say you have every person has to use
this cryptocurrency they did it back in
1913 where they said okay everyone will
use our printed dollar that is the
currency period they can do the same
thing with cryptocurrency and this is
why we see their this is why we see
there's a battle going on between the
finance system and the cryptocurrency
system and this battle is going to wage
on as we move forward now we've been
looking at many different indicators and
each indicator lets us know that things
are deteriorating very very quickly and
one of the indicators that we're looking
at right now which is a leading
indicator this is why the Fed gets
worried when this indicator flashes red
well that's credit problems and credit
problems always appear first at the
margins now the credit problem appear
first among the most fragile most at
risk
most strung out borrowers with subprime
credit ratings and the small banks and
bigger banks they went after these types
of people very very aggressively and
we're starting to see there's a major
problem in this area now small banks
they pushed with all their might into
credit cards loosening credit standards
lowering credit score requirements
raising credit limits and offering new
cards to people who already had maxed
out their existing cards and added
limited or no ability to service them
from their income and no way of paying
them off and thus are stuck with a huge
amount of debt and their balances are
very high interest rates are very high
and these individuals are in trouble
now for small banks it was the holy
grail to profit from the American debt
slave there are about four thousand
eight hundred and eighty eight
commercial banks in the u.s. there are
the top 100 banks and then there are
four thousand seven hundred eighty eight
smaller banks those with less than 14
billion in assets now we need to
remember that
these banks they were paying next to
nothing in interest to their depositors
but they could charge 25 or 30 percent
interest on outstanding credit card
balances the interest rate spread
between these two products was was
incredible and this is why they loved it
they loved what was going on
now small banks are getting their clocks
cleaned by these American debt slaves
because what is happening right now well
a lot of these individuals they're maxed
out we're seeing a huge
charge-off rate right now and people are
in trouble and we're starting to see
that these banks these smaller banks
they are writing off a lot of these
credit card failures now the banks have
been writing off losses and they spiked
to around 7.5% in the third quarter and
7.4 percent in the fourth quarter and
this is coming from the Fed Board of
Governors those were the highest
charge-off rates since the second
quarter of 2010 up from 4.6 percent a
year earlier and up from 3.5%
two years earlier credit card charge
wharfs at the largest 100 banks are also
increasing but very slowly because what
they did was they offloaded the weight
of who took out a credit card and who
handed out a credit card over to the
smaller banks so the bigger banks didn't
have to feel the brunt of all of this
and what we're seeing right now is
something very similar to the 2008 Great
Recession where we saw charged-off rates
at small banks well they hit a peak
around eight point eight percent of the
fourth quarter of 2009 so we're very
close to eight point eight percent were
already at seven point four percent and
it's continually trending higher and
higher now the smaller banks the four
thousand seven hundred and eighty eight
smaller banks they hold a very small
portion of all banking assets including
credit card balances so this might not
even jeopardize the financial system but
the surge in charge-offs
at these banks
does give a glimpse at the credit
problems at the margin and this is a
leading indicator for a broader cycle
because we saw the same thing happened
back prior to 2008 now it doesn't matter
who's holding the credit cards right now
which bank but what the the most
important thing is that these
credit-card charge offs they are rising
very very quickly and this is exactly
what we're seeing right now and this is
another indicator to let us know we are
back to where we were now everyone is
out there and the corporate media the
government with their manipulative

everyone's looking at everything saying
everything is pretty good except for the

there's a reason for it because Andrew

there are many corporate media articles

he doesn't even want after the only

eventually what they're going to do is

they want control of the narrative and

who brings the system down and we see

we don't have a trade system we don't

I don't think China they're going to
